entry.name: odd
entry.title: .odd()
entry.desc: Reduce the set of matched elements to the odd ones in the set, numbered from zero.

longdesc.p: Given a jQuery object that represents a set of DOM elements, the .odd() method constructs a new jQuery object from the odd elements in that set. Counting starts from zero!
Consider a page with a simple list on it:
We can apply this method to the set of list items:
The result of this call is a red background for the second & 4th items.

example.desc: Highlight the odd items in a list.
